byline.contributor: Ashley Parker reported from Ayrshire, and Maggie Haberman from New York.
byline.original: By ASHLEY PARKER and MAGGIE HABERMAN

abstract: Republican presidential nominee Donald J Trump leaves campaign trail to travel to Scotland to promote golf course his company purchased in 2014, with no plans to meet with any government officials or political leaders; to many, isolated itinerary in midst of serious general election campaign emphasizes just how unusual a candidate Trump is.
lead_paragraph: Presidential contenders usually try to burnish their foreign policy credentials when abroad. Mr. Trump plans no meetings with government or political leaders.

headline.main: Despite Campaign Woes, Donald Trump Flies to Scotland to Tend to Business Interests
headline.print_headline: Trump Flies to Scotland to Tend to Golf Business

snippet: Presidential contenders usually try to burnish their foreign policy credentials when abroad. Mr. Trump plans no meetings with government or political leaders.
